body_html:
The mention bot can just be added as a webhook. It's awesome. You should
add it too. I wish I had the same for issues, and we'll be working on
something like that soon. :)

On Fri, Sep 9, 2016 at 8:59 AM, Damien Martin-Guillerez <
notifications@github.com> wrote:

@martinwicke https://github.com/martinwicke I like your mention bot,
can we have the same? :) Can we train tensorflow to do review instead of us
:D

Anyway LGTM AFAICT but I don't now about the nvcc flag itself. For gcc we
call the compiler to know if the option is supported but for NVCC it is
probably ok to just include it raw.

—
You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
#4300 (comment),
or mute the thread
https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAjO_efnWGxyoswG0IQmPjxaMlCAoMYcks5qoYJ8gaJpZM4J5MIH
.

body:
The mention bot can just be added as a webhook. It's awesome. You should
add it too. I wish I had the same for issues, and we'll be working on
something like that soon. :)

On Fri, Sep 9, 2016 at 8:59 AM, Damien Martin-Guillerez <
notifications@github.com> wrote:

> @martinwicke https://github.com/martinwicke I like your mention bot,
> can we have the same? :) Can we train tensorflow to do review instead of us
> :D
> 
> Anyway LGTM AFAICT but I don't now about the nvcc flag itself. For gcc we
> call the compiler to know if the option is supported but for NVCC it is
> probably ok to just include it raw.
>
